name: Genius Loci
description:
Genius Loci is a compilation of 200+ custom nodes. It allows to export from Revit, import, interact with linked files and Revit documents, manage materials and graphics, and automate dimensions.
Works with Dynamo 1.3.x and 2.x

Some nodes from other packages have been modified to work with linked Revit files.
Thanks to the original authors for their great script.

geniusloci.bim@gmail.com

20.05.14 Added Link DWF, Copy DWFMarkup and Print Settings Properties nodes.
20.04.29 Added Group Lines by Orthogonality and Element Filter By Name (equals, contains, doesn't contain) nodes
20.04.23 Added Parse and Export PAT File nodes, Purge using API. Improvement for the creation of tags on linked elements.
20.04.16 Added nodes to batch create fill patterns, Element Inner Centroid and FamilyInstance.ByReference nodes.
20.04.04 Added CAD Layer Overrides, Create Family Parameter and All Elements at Phase nodes.
Updated Material Change Texture Path, CAD Layer Visibility and Set SubCategory Properties nodes.
20.03.24 Added All Elements at Level+, Element Change Level, Element Origin Reference, Family Document, Reset Materials Properties, Material Find Texture Path and Dimension Properties nodes. Updated Create Material, Get Project Locations and Dimension ByReferences nodes.
19.09.03 Revised custom node inputs for Dynamo 2.2
19.08.23 Added AppearanceAsset Get Properties, Get and Set Material Properties, Link IFC nodes.
19.05.27 Added Manage Worksets of RevitLinkInstance and Family Get SubCategory nodes.
Updated various nodes.
2019.5.6 Added FamilyInstance Reference Line, 3DView Toggle To Isometric, updated Export IFC.
2019.2.22 Added Convert Linked Reference node
2019.02.06 Updated Compound Surfaces References node. Added Compound Edges References, Create 3DView and Create Note Block Schedule nodes.
2019.1.28 Updated Set SubCategory Properties. Added FamilyInstance Symbolic Lines, Set Wall JoinType, Wall Edges References, Element Points References and Set SystemType Properties nodes.
2019.1.20 Added Get Elements at Ends and Get Joined Elements nodes.
2019.1.14 Added Create Compound System FamilyType, Get SystemType Properties, Set SketchPlane By Line, Compound Surfaces References and Element Pattern Reference nodes.
2019.01.01 Added FamilyInstance Reference, FamilyInstance ReferenceType, Wall Layer References, Element Reference, and Dimension ByReferences nodes.
2018.12.17 Added Wall CompoundStructureLayersLocation and Tag Set Location nodes.
Updated Create Line Pattern.
2018.12.09 Updated Tag Get tagged Element node (it now works with tags on linked elements and linked rooms)Added View Range and Create Line Pattern nodes.
2018.11.29 Added support for Foreground and Background Patterns (Revit 2019) in various nodes.
Added Override FillPattern in View (for Revit 2019)
Added Material Create and Add AppearanceAssetElement, Material Set Render Appearance Color and FilledRegion Color Change nodes.
2018.11.22 Added 3DView Lock or Unlock, 3DView Restore Orientation, Create Sheet List Schedule, Create View List Schedule, Get Pinned Element and Get Hidden Element nodes.
2018.11.02 Added View Properties, Collector of UserWorksets, Collector of Detail Items Types, and Tag Get tagged Element nodes. Updated SelectByCategoryAnd3DView node.
2018.10.20 Added Display Units, ReportRevitLinks and Reload Revit Links.
2018.10.16 Adding nodes to create Material, to set Rendering Color and Tint Color, to change Texture Path and to Get and Set Appearance Asset.
2018.10.09 Added Railing SetPath
Added Get/ Set and Create DWG Export Setup nodes
Added Purge Unused
2018.10.02  Added Get Elements Overrides
2018.09.16  Added Reload CADLinks
Updated Print PDF in document
2018.09.05 Added Get Phase Map
Added Collector of FillPatternElement
Added FilledRegion Pattern Change
Added Enumerate Datum Extent Type
Added Switch between 2D or 3D extent
2018.08.27 Added the ability to tag linked elements to the node Create Independent Tag.
Added Tag Is Orphaned
Added Get Phase Filter Presentation
Added Get Phase Filter
contents:
3DView by BoundingBox - Use a boundingbox to create a new 3D View with a specified name and a section box.
Inspired by an archilab node., 3DView ByEyeUpForwardDirections - Sets the orientation of a given 3D view based on a given eye position, an Up and a forward directions.
Based on a script by Mark Ackerley, 3DView Create - Creates a new isometric View3D in the given document., 3DView Lock or Unlock - Use a boolean True to unlock the 3D view. 
False locks the 3D view and saves its orientation.
(The default 3D view aka {3D} must be renamed to be saved), 3DView Restore Orientation - Locks the view and restores its orientation.
The 3D view must have been locked once., 3DView Set Orientation - This node will copy the orientation from the desired 3D view and apply it to a list of 3D views.
The 3D views will be locked.
The name of the 3D view mustn't include any special characters  \ : {} etc.
Based on a Ben Osborne's script., 3DView To BoundingBox - Extract section boxes from desired 3D views, and convert them into bounding box element.
Based on Amy Williams's script., 3DView Toggle To Isometric - Use a boolean True to toggle the 3D view to isometric. 
False toggles the 3D view to perspective., Acquire Coordinates - Works only in Revit 2018 and later.
Acquires coordinates from the specified link instance (RevitLinkInstance or DWG ImportInstance).
The geolocation information will be pulled from the linked model to the host model., Align Pattern To Edges - Aligns the lines of the surface (model) pattern with the bottom and right edges. 
The element can be a roof, a floor, a ceiling or a wall., All Elements at Level+ - Get all the elements at the specified Level from the model. Unlike the OOTB node it works with MEP Curves and Structural Framings., All Elements at Phase - Collect all elements at a given phase., All Elements at Workset - Collect all elements at a given workset.
Works with a workset name or with a Autodesk.Revit.DB.Workset., All Elements of Types in Document - Collect all elements of a type in a given document., Annotation BoundingBox - Get the BoundingBox of the view specific element. (Text, tag, etc), AppearanceAsset Create - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Create an AppearanceAsset by duplicating an existing rendering asset.
Please note : The asset will be duplicated with all its properties (category, color, image...), AppearanceAsset Duplicate - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Duplicates an AppearanceAsset Element., AppearanceAsset Get Properties - Get all the properties and their values from an AppearanceAsset., AppearanceAsset Set Color - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Set the color property into the rendering color of the AppearanceAsset Element., Borrow Element - Obtains ownership for the current user of as many specified elements as possible. , CAD Layer Overrides - Get the graphic overrides applied to the CAD link or import layers (Imported Categories) in the given view., CAD Layer Visibility - Checks if the layers (Imported Categories) of the CAD link or import are set to be invisible (hidden) in the given view., Collector of 3DViews - Retrieves the 3D views in the active or given document., Collector of AppearanceAsset - Retrieves all the AppearanceAsset Elements in the model., Collector of Detail Items Types - Retrieves all the Detail Items Family Types in the model., Collector of DWFMarkup - Collects all DWF Markup in the document or in the active sheet view., Collector of FillPatternElement - Collect Fill Pattern Elements and separate the pattern types between Drafting and Model., Collector of Levels - Collects Levels in the active or given document.
Based on a Lunchbox node., Collector of PlacedViews - This node will collect all views placed on sheets in the active or given document., Collector of Print Settings - Collects printsettings and their names in the active or given document.
Inspired by an archilab node., Collector of UserWorksets - Retrieves the UserWorksets and their proprieties in the active or given document., Collector of Views - Collects all views (without the sheets) in the active or given document.
Inspired by an archilab node., Collector of ViewSheetSets - Retrieve all available View Sets in the active or given document.
Use with ViewSheetSet.Views from Clockwork package.
Inspired by an archilab node., Compound Edges References - Get the vertical edges and their references of the roof, floor, ceiling or wall.
Also works with linked element., Compound Pattern Reference - Retrieves Surface, Material, Fill Pattern and its references of a roof, floor, ceiling or wall.
These references can then be used to dimension the FillPattern.
Also works with linked element., Compound Surfaces References - Retrieves Top, Bottom and Side Faces, Materials, and references of a roof, floor, ceiling or wall if applicable.
Also works with linked element., Convert Linked Reference - Creates a usable reference from a reference from a linked document., Convert Point in Coordinate Systems - Get location point in the 3 coordinate systems : Shared Coordinates, Project Coordinates, Relative Origin Coordinates.
Based on a Daniel Woodcock's script., Convert text file - Convert exported schedules from format Unicode to ANSI (or utf_8), Create Annotation Tag (Multi-Category) - Note : This method is deprecated in Revit 2019.
This node will create a tag at a given location, of given type and in a supplied view.
Works also with linked rooms.
Area tag, Multi Category tag and Material Tag have been added to the original node.
Based on an archilab node, Create Compound System FamilyType - Creates a new compound wall, floor, roof or ceiling Type and assigns material, width and function., Create DWG Export Setup - Create a DWG export settings with values of the given DWGExportOptions., Create Family Parameter - Creates a family parameter in the active family.
Can also be used to associate a label with a given dimension., Create Fill Pattern - Creates a new FillPatternElement with a repeating sequence of angles, origins, shifts, offsets, 
dashes and spaces., Create Independent Tag - Works only in Revit 2018 and later.
This node will create a tag at a given location, of given type and in a supplied view. 
The node also works with Linked Elements (except space and area), Multi Category tag and Material Tag.
Based on an archilab node, Create Legend Component - Create a new legend component by duplicating an existing in the given legend view.
Please note : At least one legend component must be placed in the legend view., Create Line Pattern - Creates a new LinePatternElement.
A line pattern is made of dashes, dots alternating with spaces. A space must end the sequence., Create Material - Note : This method is deprecated in Revit 2019.
Create new materials or overwrite properties of existing materials.
Inspired by Dynamo Forum., Create Note Block Schedule - Create a Note Block Schedule of Generic Annotations with Count and Type fields., Create Phase Filter - Creates a new phase filter with default status presentation.
The default status presentation is ShowByCategory for New status, and ShowOverriden for Existing, Demolished and Temporary statuses. , Repeating sequence for FillPattern - Select a group of Revit Lines to produce a repeating sequence of angles, origins, shifts, offsets, 
dashes and spaces.. 
For patterns that have a lot of blank space, it is possible to add a border.  Just type in the Line Style that you are using if one exists; it doesn't have to be square.
The Slope Tolerance governs the available Angle at which the diagonal lines will be corrected. Feel free to increase it, but if a line family exceeds or 30 000 millimeters, the pattern will probably not been seen. 
Watch the Slope Tolerance Results to see why a FillPattern doesn't appear.
Arc lines will fail.
By dcmasten1 on forum.dynamobim.com, Create Shared Parameter - Add parameter to the shared parameter file and then add it to the project.
It is possible to use an existing GUID to recreate an identical shared parameter in a new SP file.
Inspired by archilab, Create Sheet List Schedule - Create a Sheet List Schedule with Sheet Number, Sheet Name, Current Revision and Current Revision Date., Create View List Schedule - Create a View List Schedule with View Name, View Template, Sheet Number and Sheet Name fields., CurtainWall Horizontal References - Collects references from the horizontal grid lines of the curtain wall. Also works with a linked curtain wall., CurtainWall Vertical References - Collects references from the vertical grid lines of the curtain wall. Also works with a linked curtain wall., Delete Elements in Document - Delete the input list of elements from the given Revit document.
The node returns the number of successfully deleted elements and their Ids as a string.
Based on a Springs node, Dimension ByReferences - Creates a new linear dimension from at least two geometric references of an object., Dimension Properties - Returns the origin of the dimension, the dimension's curve, the value, the text position, the prefix, the suffix, the value override and all elements that are referenced by the given dimension, Display Units - Enumerate the UnitTypes and the UnitGroups and returns their DisplayUnitTypes and UnitSymbols associated., Document SaveAs - Saves the given Revit document under the given name.
Based on a Clockwork node, Element Change Level - Change the element to the selected level without moving the element.
Doesn't work with hosted family (Wall Based) and Work Plane based family (without Reference Level or with read-only Schedule Level)., Element Filter By Name Contains - Filter elements by part of their name., Element Filter By Name DoesNotContain - Filter elements by part of their name., Element Filter By Name Equals - Filter elements by given name., Element Host - Gets the host of the element.
Unlike the OOTB node FamilyInstance.GetHost, it also works for elements hosted by a linked document, wall sweeps, foundations, railings and builing pads.
Based on a Clockwork's node, Element Inner Centroid - Finds pole of inaccessibility for a given polygon. 
Calculates the visual center of a polygon (inside the polygon).
Based on Vladimir Agafonkin's algorithm Polylabel., Element Level - Gets an element's level.
Based on a Clockwork's node, Element LocationCurve - Gets the curve geometry from the element., Element Origin Reference - Retrieves the origin point of the family instance., Element Parameters Properties - Retrieves all the properties of the parameters from a given element in the active or given document., Element Points References - Returns the references to the start and the end points of the curve based element., Element Reference - Gets the reference of a geometric object or a dimension or a reference plane., Element Surfaces References - Retrieve the top, bottom, side surfaces and their associated references of the system family.
This doesn't work with cylindrical system families (pipe...), Element to Document - Returns the Document in which the Element resides, the document's filename and filepath., Elements From Linked File in Space - This node will check what elements from a linked model are inside of any of the spaces in the current model.
Based on an archilab node, Enum JoinType - Enumerate the type of join at the end of an element. Use with Set Wall JoinType node, Enumerate Datum Extent Type - Enumerate Datum Extent Type : Model (3D extent) or ViewSpecific (2D extent).
Use with "Switch between 2D or 3D extent" node., Enumerate DWG export options - Enumerate Color mode, Autocad Version and Type of Units., Enumerate DWG import options - Enumerate Color mode, Type of Placement and Type of Unit.
Works with the "Link DWG" and "Import DWG" nodes., Enumerate ElementOnPhaseStatus - The statuses that an element can have with respect to a given phase., Enumerate LayerFunction - Enumerate the functions of the layers of the Compound System Family., Enumerate Naviswork Coordinates and Exportscope - Use with the "Export NWC in Document" node., Enumerate PhaseStatusPresentation - An enumerated type listing the options for element display in a phase filter., Export DWFx in Document - Export Views to DWFx file in the active or given document., Export DWG in Document - Export views to DWG with export setup in the active or given document.
Based on an archilab's script., Export DXF - Exports views to DXF file., Export IFC in Document - Export Views to IFC file from document.
The Project Origin option works only with Revit 2018 and above.
Some other IFC options are embedded inside the python script., Export IFC - Export View to IFC file.
For use with the Select Phase node.
Some other IFC options are embedded inside the python script., Export NWC in Document - !! This node needs Navisworks Exporters for Revit to export NWC.
This node exports Views to NWC files in the active or given document.
Navisworks options are embedded inside the python script., Export PAT File - Exports as string a Fill Pattern Element in a .pat (pattern) file ., Family Document Close - Close the given document with the option to save the changes., Family Document - Gets the family document by family or family instance. (Opens the family in the background)
Use the "Family Document Close" node to close the family. , Family Get SubCategory - Retrieves the subcategories for a given family or family instance or family document., FamilyDocument Parameters - Retrieves all family parameters from the given or active family document., FamilyInstance 2D Geometry - Gets the curves of the family instance.
Works only with the family categories : Generic Annotation and Detail Item., FamilyInstance Reference ByRefLine - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Gets family instance references corresponding to the reference lines in the instance's family., FamilyInstance Reference ByRefName - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Gets the reference corresponding to the named reference plane in the instance's family. , FamilyInstance Reference ByRefPlane - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Gets family instance references corresponding to the reference planes in the instance's family. , FamilyInstance ReferenceType - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Identifies references of family instances corresponding to reference planes and reference lines in the family., FamilyInstance Symbolic Lines - Obtains the symbolic lines of the family instance in the active view.
(For example, the lines and the arcs of a door in a project plan view.), FamilyInstance.ByReference - Inserts a new instance of a family onto a face referenced by the input Reference, using a location, reference direction, and a type/symbol. , FamilyType Preview - Get the preview image of an element. 
This image is similar to what is seen in the Revit UI when selecting the type of an element.
Inspired by Forum Dynamo, FilenameToFilePaths - Add directory and .pdf extension to filenames.
Be careful with forbidden characters in filenames  (* . " / \ : ;)
For use with the "Remove Special Characters from String" node., Fill Pattern HostOrientation - Enumerates the types of orientations for fill patterns (OrientToView, KeepReadable, AlignWithHost).
To use with the Create FillPattern node., Fill Pattern Properties - Returns the target, orientation, angles, origins, shifts, offsets, dashes and spaces of a given fill pattern., FilledRegion LineStyle Change - Change the linestyle of the boundaries of a Filled Region to another given linestyle., FilledRegion Properties Change - Assigns Pattern, Color and Line Weight to the given Filled Region or to a Filled Region Type.
Note : Prior to Revit 2019, the materials have only one surface pattern and one cut pattern., Get Category Properties - Get the Line Patterns, weights, colors and materials for a given category., Get CompoundStructureLayers - Retrieves the properties of the compound layers of wall, floor, roof or ceiling Type., Get DependentElements - Returns all elements which are children of this Element and that will be deleted with it., Get DWG Export Setup - Collect the DWGExportOptions stored in the ExportDwgSettings., Get Element Color Overrides - Retrieves the color of the element with several methods (view-specific, view filter and material overrides)., Get Element Worksharing Tooltip Info - Returns worksharing informations (Creator, LastChangedBy, Owner) about element in the given document., Get Elements at Ends - Get the two elements joining to the ends., Get Elements Overrides - Note: This method is deprecated in Revit 2019.
Get the overrides applied to the elements in the given View., Get Hidden Element - Reports the hidden elements in the given view., Get Joined Elements - Returns all elements joined to the given element., Get Material Properties - Note : This method is deprecated in Revit 2019.
Get name, color, transparency, Surface and Cut patterns from the given material.., Get Phase Filter by Name - Enter the name of the phase filter to get the phase filter element., Get Phase Filter - Get available Phase Filters, Get Phase Map - Works only in Revit 2019 and later.
The node returns a mapping between phases in the host document and phases in the linked document., Get Phase Status Presentation - Gets the phase status presentation., Get Pinned Element - Identify the pinned elements., Get Project Locations - Works only in Revit 2018 and later.
Retrieves the project positions with the survey point as the origin. 
(Coordinates of Internal origin, project base point and survey point), Get rooms by name or number - Enter the room name or number to get the room.
Inspired by jeremy@learndynamo.com, Get ScheduleView - Get Schedule View from ScheduleSheetInstance., Get Shared Parameter - Get the parameters names, parameters groups, parameters types and assigned categories of the active shared parameter file., Get SubCategories Properties - Get the Line Patterns, weights, colors and materials for a given subcategory., Get SystemType Properties - Returns the Mechanical or Piping System Type, the classification, the abbreviation, the line pattern, line weight, line color and the material., Get View By Name - Collect views by given name in the active or given document.
Based on a Christian Gartland's script., Get View By Type - Gets all views by type.
For the View Template Type, the 3D View Templates will not be retrieved., Get Wall Member - Returns the wall type, the sub walls of the stacked wall and the wall panel of the curtain wall., GetSurroundingElements in Document - Get Surrounding Elements by Categories, group them as List. Tolerance distance available in linked document.
Based on a SteamNodes node, Group Lines by Orthogonality - Group vertical, horizontal and oblique lines together. Works with dynamo lines et MEPCurves elements (duct, pipe, cable tray and conduit)., Group Parallel Lines - Groups parallel lines or curved elements (model and detail lines) together., Import DWG - Import DWGs in views with options.
Use with the Enumerate DWG import options node.
Based on an archilab's script., LevelBottom - This node takes an input of the level and returns level bottom it.
Based on an archilab node, Link DWG - Link DWGs in views with options.
Use with the Enumerate DWG import options node.
Based on a archilab's script., Link IFC - Converts the IFC to a Revit document and link it to the active document., LogoGeniusLoci - Display logo Genius Loci.
The logo picture will be created in directory 
C:\ProgramData\Dynamo, Manage Worksets of RevitLinkInstance - Indicates the worksets to close in the Revit link and reloads it., Material Change Image and Edit it - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
The material must already have an assigned texture.
Changes the image and edit its properties.
(All inputs are optional), Material Change Texture Path - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
The material must already have an assigned texture., Material Create and Add AppearanceAssetElement - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Requires a material called Default.
Duplicates the Appearance Asset Element of the "Default" material, give him a chosen name, and applies it to the given material., Material Find Texture Path - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Find the texture paths of the materials., Material Get AppearanceAsset - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Retrieves the AppearanceAsset Elements of the given material and its Rendering Asset., Material Set AppearanceAsset - Set the AppearanceAsset Element of the given material., Material Set Render Color - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Set the rendering color in the Appearance Asset of the given material with the provided color.
If no color is provided, the node will use the shading color of the material., Material Set Tint Color - Works only in Revit 2018.1 and later.
Enable the Tint Color Property and set the Tint Color in the Appearance Asset Element of the given material., New Create Material - Works only in Revit 2019 and later.
Create new materials or overwrite properties of existing materials.
Use nulls as input to create the material without its properties (Transparency, SurfacePattern ...), New Get Elements Overrides - Works only in Revit 2019 and later.
Get the overrides applied to the elements in the given View., New Get Material Properties - Works only in Revit 2019 and later.
Get name, color, transparency, SurfaceForeground, SurfaceBackground, CutForeground and CutBackground patterns from the given material., New View Get Color of Filter - Works only in Revit 2019 and later.
Get the view filter and its colors from the given view., Override Graphics in View - Overrides element graphics settings in the given view.
(All graphic inputs are optional)
Note : Prior to Revit 2019, the materials have only one surface pattern and one cut pattern., Package Information - Displays package information., Parse PAT File - Returns the target, angles, origins, shifts, offsets, dashes and spaces of a .pat (pattern) file.
To use with the Create Fill Pattern node., Plane by Level - Constructs a Plane from a level., Print PDF (multiple formats) - This node will allow you to initiate a printing routine from a set of views/sheets, filename, printer name, print settings with many formats and print range.
Based on an archilab node., Print PDF in Document (multiple formats) - This node will allow you to initiate a printing routine from a set of views/sheets, filename, printer name, print settings with many formats and print range from document.
Based on an archilab node., Print Settings by Name - Collect printsettings by given name in the active or given document., Publish Coordinates - Works only in Revit 2018 and later.
Publish coordinates to the specified ProjectLocation of the Revit link instance.
The geolocation information will be pulled from host model to the linked model., Purge Unused UI - Using the Postable Command, run the Purge Unused function., Purge Unused - Purge the document completely including materials an assets using the API.
Works only in Revit 2017 and later., Railing SetPath - Modify the path of an existing railing., Reload CAD ImportInstance - Reloads the CAD link instance provided., Reload CADLinks - Reload imported CAD from its current location.
Works only in Revit 2018 and later., Reload RevitLinkInstance - Reloads the Revit link provided., Reload RevitLinkType in Document - Reloads all Revit links in a document Revit., Remove Special Characters from String - Useful for removing invalid characters from filenames.
For use with the FilenameToFilePaths node., Repath CAD ImportInstance - Reloads the CAD link from the input path. , Repath CADLinks - Reload imported CAD from an unique folder.
Works only in Revit 2018 and above., Repath RevitLinkInstance - Reloads the Revit link from the input path. , Repath RevitLinkType - Reloads the linked Revit file(s) from a folder., ReportRevitLinks - Inspired by Bimorph.
Generates a report of all Revit links in the document. 
Revit links properties are output to facilitate the Revit link model management., Reset Materials Properties - Clear the pattern and color of a material using a boolean True.
(All inputs are optional), Reset SystemType Graphics - Clear the line pattern, line weight, line color and  material of the given System Type., Revision to Sheet - Returns the ViewSheets where this RevisionCloud appears., Rotate Fitting - Rotates a fitting, at specified degree, around the axis of the primary MEP system element (pipe, duct, cable tray, conduit...).
By MEPover on forum.dynamobim.com, Select Point on Element - Select the point(s) on the face(s) and get the reference(s)., SelectByCategory in Document - Collect elements by category in a linked or open document in the background.
The transform CS is returned only with a LinkInstance input., SelectByCategoryAndBoundingBox - Collect elements by category from a BoundingBox., SelectByCategoryAndByLevel - Select Elements by Category and Level.
With a document input, use the Collector of Levels node to get the level input., SelectByCategoryAndDesignOption - Select all elements by Design Option and category in the given document.
Inspired by an archilab node., SelectByCategoryAndHost3DView - Collects elements in the given document by category and in the host 3D view of the active document.
The transform CS is returned only with a LinkInstance input., SelectByCategoryAndLevel - Select Elements by Category and Level.
With a document input, use the Collector of Levels node to get the level input.
This API filter doesn't work with MEP and Structural Framing elements., SelectByCategoryAndView - Collects elements by Category and View in the active or given document., SelectByFilter - Retrieves elements by the name of the selection set or rule-based filter., Set DWG Export Setup - Sets the DWGExportOptions stored in the ExportDwgSettings., Set Material Properties - Set the color, transparency, SurfaceForeground, SurfaceBackground, CutForeground and CutBackground patterns from the given material.
Note : Prior to Revit 2019, the materials have only one surface pattern and one cut pattern.
(All inputs are optional), Set Phase Status Presentation - Sets the phase status presentation. , Set ProjectLocation by Name - Set the Site by its name., Set SketchPlane By Line - Works only in Revit 2016 and later.
Selects a line, constructs a plane and assigns the sketch plane to the active view. 
An active sketch plane is required for model curve creation., Set SubCategory Properties - Assigns Line Weight, Line Pattern and Line Color to the given subcategory., Set SystemType Graphics - Assigns line pattern, line weight, line color and  material to the given System Type.
(All graphic inputs are optional), Set Wall JoinType - Change the type of the join at the ends.  (Wall Joins tool)
If the type of join is set to None, the walls will be unjoined.
Use with Enum JoinType node, SetParameterByName in Document - Set the element's parameters from a specific document., Switch between 2D or 3D extent - Switch the extents of grid and level from 2d to 3d or vice versa.
Use with "Enumerate Datum Extent Type" node., SynchronizeWithCentral in Document - Synchronizes a workshared model with the central model with the choice of the Revit document.
Based on a Clockwork node, Tag Get tagged Element - Get tagged element.
Unlike the OOTB node it works also for linked element, linked room, room, space and area categories., Tag Is Orphaned - Identify the orphaned tags.
Orphaned tags are tags that are associated with a linked document but  no longer have a host element., Tag Set Location - Moves the head of the tag to the given location point., Titleblock From Sheet - Retrieves the titleblock from the given sheet in the active or given document., Unfold Concave - Unfold curved elements like Walls or stairs.
An inner perimeter circle of the element must be drawn to intersect the geometry with it., Unfold Convex - Unfold curved elements like Walls.
An inner perimeter circle of the element must be drawn to intersect the geometry with it., Unload RevitLinkInstance - Unloads the Revit link provided., Unload RevitLinkType in Document - Unloads all Revit links in a document Revit.
Based on a Ben Osborne's script., View Get Color of Filter - Note: This method is deprecated in Revit 2019.
Get the view filter and its colors from the given view., View Properties - Returns certain properties of the given view. , View Range - Get the view range of a plan view or a plan region.
Returns the View Range Levels and the Offset values., View Types - Enumerates the available view types., Wall ByCurveAndLevel - Creates a wall using the specified guiding curve and level. , Wall CompoundStructureLayersLocation - Get the wall layers location lines., Wall Edges References - Get the vertical and horizontal edges and their references from the exterior and interior faces., Wall Layer References - Gets the references of the wall layers. (Wall's centerline, center of core, and faces of core)
Also works with linked walls.
Please note : Results are reversed for flipped walls, Wall's Elevation Profile - Obtains the curves which bound the wall's elevation profile.
Only works with a wall whose profile has been edited., Workset By Name - Retrieves the workset by the given name., Print Settings Properties - Returns the name, paper size, orientation, placement, zoom and colors of the given or collected print settings., Copy DWFMarkup Symbol to View - Place a family instance from the location of the Markup symbol for the given or active sheet.
Please note : A family type with a name similar to that of the markup symbol (label) should be loaded into the document., Get Flipped Element - Gets the flipped wall, hand flipped (hinge side) and facing flipped (interior wall side) doors., Copy DWFMarkup Curve to View - Copies the line, polyline and ellipse from the Markup objects for the given or active sheet.
Please note that markups are found by name (label) and therefore depend on the Revit localization (language)., Copy DWFMarkup RevisionCloud to View - Copies the revision cloud from the Markup objects for the given or active sheet.
Also copies the markup notes to the comments of the created revision cloud.
Please note that markups are found by name (label) and therefore depend on the Revit localization (language)., Copy DWFMarkup TextNote to View - Copies the text note from the Markup objects for the given or active sheet.
Please note that markups are found by name (label) and therefore depend on the Revit localization (language)., Link DWF - Link DWF in given sheet.
This API method doesn't work with DWF containing multiple sheets.
